author: modulexcite
body:
I have a locally created module that's not published on the gallery but stored under `My Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules` folder. When I try to import it using `Import-Module -Name MyTestModule` in the profile script it reports the following error:
> Import-Module : The given assembly name or codebase was invalid. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131047)
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Import-Module], FileLoadException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.IO.FileLoadException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand

However I can import it by running the following command:
```
Import-Module Import-Module $PSScriptRoot\Modules\MyTestModule\MyTestModule.psm1 
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Import the module to my profile.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                                
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                                
PSVersion                      5.1.14409.1005                                                                                                                                                                       
PSEdition                      Desktop                                                                                                                                                                              
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                              
BuildVersion                   10.0.14409.1005                                                                                                                                                                      
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000                                                                                                                                                                      
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                                                  
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                                  
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1    
```

comments.author: thezim
comments.body: @modulexcite I recently had a similar [issue](https://github.com/thezim/posh-stig/issues/14) with a module of mine.  ```Test-ModuleManifest``` got me the right direction. My RootModule in my .psd1 was prefixed with ```.\```. Perhaps this may help.

comments.author: modulexcite
comments.body: @thezim that sure was the problem. Thanks a lot, can't believe I missed that.

comments.author: modulexcite
comments.body: Unfortunately, I ran into another issue with this. I can now successfully import after the ISE startup but cannot dot source the module into my ISE profile as ISE gets stuck trying to process the module and I have to force quit the application. I had to uninstall the WMF v5.1 to get it to work again. It seems like it doesn't like the module manifest for some reason even though the `Test-ModuleManifest` returns no errors.
